newsitem.title: HONG KONG: S&P rates Total Access issue BBB minus.
newsitem.headline: S&P rates Total Access issue BBB minus.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Tuesday it had assigned a foreign currency long-term rating of BBB minus to Thai mobile phone company Total Access Communication's forthcoming note and bond issue totalling US$400 million.
The securities will be issued in the United States and other locations and the precise split of notes due in 2001 and bonds due in 2006 will be decided closer to the launch, Standard & Poor's said.
"The rating reflects TAC's strong financial performance, market positioning, and strategic focus in the fast-growing Thai mobile communications industry," the rating agency said.
"Offsetting these strengths are an aggressive capital expenditure program and continued regulatory uncertainty in the Thai telecommunications sector."
TAC, a unit of United Communications Plc is the second-largest mobile phone company in Thailand and controls about 41 percent of the market.
